snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky If I were to ever choose games that I would replay yearly, Super Metroid would easily be one of them.  As is though, I don't think I'm going to do that anytime soon, but it's an idea for the future...

There are 16 games that I consider myself a "big fan" of and will defend them to the death, and 8 which I consider "god tier".  Super Metroid is my 3rd favorite game of all time.  Metroid Prime is my #13.
snippet.textOriginal:
@SupraDarky If I were to ever choose games that I would replay yearly, Super Metroid would easily be one of them.  As is though, I don't think I'm going to do that anytime soon, but it's an idea for the future...

There are 16 games that I consider myself a "big fan" of and will defend them to the death, and 8 which I consider "god tier".  Super Metroid is my 3rd favorite game of all time.  Metroid Prime is my #13.

snippet.textDisplay:
@GameOSTz2 EPIC? Really? Is that what we're going to say perfectly encapsulates the Metroid series? Are we really going to just have this overused word represent the legacy of such a magnificent, beloved series? This special collection of games and game music, is merely epic?

Nostalgia's a bitch, when it comes to realizations. Is this really just epic?

snippet.textDisplay:
@Masz52 
Actually, I thought the Prime games where awesome (unfortunately, I've only been able to play 1). However, I really think it's time for a 2D game. The graphics today may be awesome and life-like, and the controls and game-mechanics may be innovative and easy-use, but it still, there will always be that nostalgia for the old games. I'm sure many fans will agree with me, and Nintendo needs to listen to it's fans.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Masz52 
Actually, I thought the Prime games where awesome (unfortunately, I've only been able to play 1). However, I really think it's time for a 2D game. The graphics today may be awesome and life-like, and the controls and game-mechanics may be innovative and easy-use, but it still, there will always be that nostalgia for the old games. I'm sure many fans will agree with me, and Nintendo needs to listen to it's fans.

snippet.textDisplay:
@pervysage35 How was Prime not "good ol' Metroid?" It was literally Super Metroid in 3D in terms of gameplay.

Though yes, I also want a new 2D game. I can't shake the feeling that Nintendo wants to forget about Metroid after Other M however...
snippet.textOriginal:
@pervysage35 How was Prime not "good ol' Metroid?" It was literally Super Metroid in 3D in terms of gameplay.

Though yes, I also want a new 2D game. I can't shake the feeling that Nintendo wants to forget about Metroid after Other M however...

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky 
What they should do is either make a new 2D SIDE-SCROLLING Metroid for the 3DS (called Metroid Dread:), or make a SM remake. No 3D, no Melee attacks or 1st person, no people, no spoken lines or in-game cut-scenes. Just good ol' Metroid.
snippet.textOriginal:
@SupraDarky

snippet.textDisplay:
Two things you didn't know about Metroid:
*Gravity Suit sucks in Other M because the director of the game thought purple would look stupid in serious cutscenes..... (seriously)
*Samus turns into a morphball because it was too difficult to make a crawling animation (in other words the developers were too lazy)
And another thing: yesterday was its 25 anniversary and Nintendo didn't even bother to mention it....
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: This one's a classic. Well it's been 25 years since this game's release, just a tad younger than I am. One of my favorite series of all time and I still go through Super Metroid at least yearly. I'm quite disapointed Nintendo didn't do anything special for the anniversary, like they did with Mario and are doing with Zelda.
